result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Spencer

defendant.name: Spencer, David A.
defendant.address: 304 West Glen Street, Room 16, Crandon, WI 54520

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: payment plan summary and petition and order directing compensation

Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:48 PM. State - discussion off record, Spencer is in hospital, although able to proceed without him and has followed victim notification, victim is in court. Victim Impact Statement is in file. Victim makes statement. Ferguson - agreement is to amend count 1 to FC ordinance of DC, is authorized to enter plea of NC, fine of $100 plus costs. State agrees. Victim questions court on why she was not aware of plea offer. State indicates proper proceedure and does not include offers with victim. Court - amends count 1 to FC ordinance of DC, court accepts plea entered by attorney and imposes fine of $100.00 plus costs with 60 DTP/CO.

Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:18 PM. Defendant was here and released. State - set for another FPT. Ferguson agrees. Court continues bond, set for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant David A. Spencer in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:21 AM. State has provided the defendant with the criminal complaint, states the defendant may be under pain meds at this time due to a recent injury. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Spencer understands charges and penalties, would like an attorney. Court finds the defendant is not eligible for SPD, will appoint Attorney Amy Ferguson to this case. Spencer will come back at 1:15 so that the attorney can be here. Recalled at 1:20 PM. David Spencer appears in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson. State appears by Charles Simono. Court informs Attorney Ferguson that she has been appointed to this case. Ferguson has gone over the complaint with the defendant, waives reading, enters NG plea. Court continues bond.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (B.Z.)
